Name: Boozy Suzie
Ingredients: 15 ml Gentian liqueur (e.g. Suze, Salers etc)
10 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
2 dash Peychaud's or other Creole-style bitters
7.5 ml Egg white (pasteurised) or 																																			Aquafaba (chickpea water)																								 or 3 dashes Fee Brothers Fee Foam cocktail foamer
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of pink grapefruit zest twist (discarded) & 3 spots of Peychaud's bitters drawn through foamy head.
SHAKE all ingredients with ice and strain back into shaker.
Review: Bittersweet gentian is the prevalent flavour (hence the 'Suzie' name), toned down by bianco vermouth and freshened with pink grapefruit over a fortifying grainy vodka base. Peychaud's subtly adds its distinctive flavour.
History: Created in August 2015 by yours truly at the Cabinet Room, London, England.
Nutrition: One serving of Boozy Suzie contains 188 calories
